headline: What recent earnings are saying about state of the US consumer
summary: After a slew of earnings reports out from Delta Air Lines (DAL), Levi Strauss (LEVI), and PepsiCo (PEP), how is the state of the US consumer shaping up in late 2025? Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma explains what these consumer-exposed companies are saying about American spending and consumer sentiment. Catch Yahoo Finance's full interview with PepsiCo chairman and CEO Ramon Laguarta. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: PEP Q3 CY2025 Deep Dive: Balancing Innovation, Cost Controls, and Shifting Consumer Behavior
summary: Food and beverage company PepsiCo (NASDAQ:PEP) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 2.7% year on year to $23.94 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.29 per share was 1.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: How Carlsberg's UK Soft Drinks Expansion With PepsiCo Has Changed Its Investment Story (CPSE:CARL B)
summary: Carlsberg Britvic, in partnership with PepsiCo, recently announced an exclusive UK distribution agreement for Poppi, a US prebiotic soda brand, and is exploring further portfolio expansion with Mexican-style beer and functional soft drinks. Carlsberg has also invested £20 million in a new soft drinks canning line at its Rugby facility, increasing capacity and reinforcing its focus on production and supply chain enhancements in the UK. We will explore how Carlsberg's expanded soft drinks...
